data.title: Really good place to grab quick Thai food
data.text:
Taste of Thai is great... the folks who work there are always friendly and helpful.  The food is really good and quick.  I try to go often, but it's sometimes a little hard to find a parking spot there.
Definitely recommend you give it a try...

data.title: Hidden Temple Secret
data.text: Great Thai food at a super value. This little hidden Thai restaurant off W. Central Ave. in Temple, TX is a hidden gem. They serve the classic Thai dishes--pad thai, pad woon sen, tom yum soup, pork ball soup and a variety of fried rice dishes and they are all great. In addition they serve mango and sweet rice when in season. If you haven't tried this dessert dish you are missing out on a real treat. Definitely worth a visit or three! Pay mind to their hours--they are only open for lunch on Saturdays and only open for dinner until 8 p.m. Mon--Fri.

data.title: Great food affordable prices
data.text:
Pros: Great food recommend medium spice and I like heat but spicy too much, great prices, quick service, free appetizer 
 Wong ton strip & duck sauce

Cons: n/a

data.title: Great Lunch Dining
data.text: They offer great food and pretty quick.  Good service each time I have been for lunch.  Nice to know that it is cooked to order.

data.title: Like this little dive!
data.text: I always get the Pad-ti or the Pad-mei with beef and chicken.  It tastes the same every time!  You get very big servings.  One order is usually enough for my husband and I.  I love the complimentary fried won-ton strips with duck sauce!  If you share an entree you can both eat for less that $10.

data.title: BEST THAI IN TOWN!
data.text: The best and most flavorful Thai around ! Fresh ingredients and cooked with love and care! Great friendly service!

data.title: Awesome Thai Food!
data.text: I eat at Taste of Thai all the time and it's my favorite restaurant in Temple.  Their menu is extensive with a number of Thai and Chinese favorites and some specialties too.  They're prices are great, and you get a lot of food.  They have a great lunch menu too with all of your favorites.  You get a drink and an egg roll with the meal.  Everyone that works here is very friendly and the service is fast. I've had Thai food all over the United States and this is some of the best I've ever had.

data.title: Go to MeeMee's instead
data.text: I was in town for business for two days. This was right around the corner from where I was for the day, so I went in not knowing any better. It was cheap and okay. But I got pretty standard Pad Thai and it wasn't like anything I've ever had before. I would not go again, especially when you have Mee Mee's in town.

data.title: Not a fan
data.text:
- Service was poor - our of silverware, and when we asked for some, it was thrown into the containers, when we were the only customers in the room waiting to eat...
- Food was bad - didn't have much flavor, the meat tasted like freezer burn
- Prices were high for the quality of food
- We won't be back

data.title: Great Asian Food....Good Prices
data.text:
First of all....you get a great portion for food for the price you pay!  They service was great and very personable....especially since I went through the drive-thru.
I had heard about this place from friends and I finally went and tried it.  Picked up some food for dinner on the way home from basketball practice one night in August.  I have been back almost weekly since!

data.title: Inexpensive and quick meal.
data.text:
I asked for suggestions for dinner from a local lady, and this sounded good to try. I made the assumption that it was a casual dining type place (thinking Chili's type atmosphere) but it was more like a fast-food place.

I ordered a beef dish and spring roll and took the meal back to my hotel.  The girl at the counter was friendly (and told me what the most popular dishes are when I told her it was my first visit).

The spring roll was EXCELLENT! The entrée was ok - vegetables were very fresh but the beef was a little bland. My food was ready very quickly and the total bill was $14.00 - including tip.  Very inexpensive and the portions were generous.  I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here, but wouldn't hesitate to go back for a quick, inexpensive meal.

data.title: Not Thai As I Know It
data.text:
I love and have eaten hundreds of Thai meals in dozens of locales from coast to coast. This hardly bears a resemblance to what I know as Thai cuisine. 

I did not see a single Thai person there. Our order, at a counter, was taken by a woman who assumed steamed and fried tofu are the same. (They only offer it fried.) Perplexingly, cream in your Thai tea is an additional charge, which is sort of like charging you more for sauce on your pizza. 

The lunch menu was unclear. Some items came with extras, while inexplicably, others did not. Employees were eating, while dirty dishes sat unattended on empty tables. When I asked for eating utensils, the server motioned as she walked past them on her exit, though she had seen me walk in on crutches. 

The entrees were bland, greasy, and the noodles had a microwave-reheated texture. The eggrolls came halfway through the entrees. Then, the same server tried to clear our dishes as we were standing to leave, rather than giving us a moment to gather our things. Especially strange, given her earlier lack of motivation. 

The only positive was a relatively low bill, but I would gladly pay more for a pleasant experience.

data.title: Decent Thai food.
data.text: We've been here several times and have always ordered the Pad Thai. It's good! Not mind-blowing, but flavorful and well-made. (The noodles don't seem as thick as Pad Thai dishes at other restaurants, and it contains lots of carrots.) Not much in the way of atmosphere, but it has a good location in downtown Temple.

data.title: Cheap...so is the quality
data.text: Located in downtown Temple.  We were a group of 7 that went there for lunch.  You order your food at the counter and they bring the food to the table.  The menu items are limited and cheap, approximately $7-8.  They had the usual mix of Thai menu items: noodle based (Pad Thai, etc.), curry, stir fry, and noodle soups.  Unfortunately, the food did not taste good.  In our group of 7, 4 of us could not finish our food because of the taste.  I ordered cashew chicken and my wife ordered a noodle dish with chicken (pad kee ma?) and the chicken was not fully cooked.  I guess there is something to the expression that you get what you pay for!  If you are yearning for Thai food, I suggest you skip this one.
